column4: I just partitioned a new drive with gparted and I have (primary /sdb1, primary /sdb3, primary /sdb4, extension /sdb2, logical /sdb5 etc.) Is it a problem that the extension is on sdb2? I thought it would go on sbd4?
how will windows see the partitions?
well there's some fat32 partitions on the extension
ext2fs WILL let windows see ext2/3 partitions
